summary.long: Luke is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Now many have undertaken to compile an account of the things that have been fulfilled among us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: like the accounts passed on to us by those who were eyewitnesses and servants of the word from the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it seemed good to me as well, because I have followed all things carefully from the beginning, to write an orderly account for you, most excellent Theophilus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you may know for certain the things you were taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During the reign of Herod king of Judea, there lived a priest named Zechariah who belonged to the priestly division of Abijah, and he had a wife named Elizabeth, who was a descendant of Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were both righteous in the sight of God, following all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blamelessly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not have a child, because Elizabeth was barren, and they were both very old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while Zechariah was serving as priest before God when his division was on duty,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he was chosen by lot, according to the custom of the priesthood, to enter the Holy Place of the Lord and burn incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the whole crowd of people were praying outside at the hour of the incense offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An angel of the Lord, standing on the right side of the altar of incense, appeared to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zechariah, visibly shaken when he saw the angel, was seized with fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the angel said to him, “Do not be afraid, Zechariah, for your prayer has been heard, and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son; you will name him John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joy and gladness will come to you, and many will rejoice at his birth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he will be great in the sight of the Lord. He must never drink wine or strong drink, and he will be filled with the Holy Spirit, even before his birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will turn many of the people of Israel to the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he will go as forerunner before the Lord in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers back to their children and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just, to make ready for the Lord a people prepared for him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zechariah said to the angel, “How can I be sure of this? For I am an old man, and my wife is old as well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel answered him, “I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God, and I was sent to speak to you and to bring you this good news.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, because you did not believe my words, which will be fulfilled in their time, you will be silent, unable to speak, until the day these things take place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the people were waiting for Zechariah, and they began to wonder why he was delayed in the Holy Place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came out, he was not able to speak to them. They realized that he had seen a vision in the Holy Place, because he was making signs to them and remained unable to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his time of service was over, he went to his home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After some time his wife Elizabeth became pregnant, and for five months she kept herself in seclusion. She said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord has done for me at the time when he has been gracious to me, to take away my disgrace among people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the sixth month of Elizabeth’s pregnancy, the angel Gabriel was sent by God to a town of Galilee called Nazareth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to a virgin engaged to a man whose name was Joseph, a descendant of David, and the virgin’s name was Mary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel came to her and said, “Greetings, favored one, the Lord is with you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she was greatly troubled by his words and began to wonder about the meaning of this greeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the angel said to her, “Do not be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Listen: You will become pregnant and give birth to a son, and you will name him Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be great, and will be called the Son of the Most High, and the Lord God will give him the throne of his father David.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He will reign over the house of Jacob forever, and his kingdom will never end.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary said to the angel, “How will this be, since I have not been intimate with a man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel replied, “The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you. Therefore the child to be born will be holy; he will be called the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “And look, your relative Elizabeth has also become pregnant with a son in her old age—although she was called barren, she is now in her sixth month!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nothing will be impossible with God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Mary said, “Yes, I am a servant of the Lord; let this happen to me according to your word.” Then the angel departed from her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days Mary got up and went hurriedly into the hill country, to a town of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and entered Zechariah’s house and greeted Elizabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Elizabeth heard Mary’s greeting, the baby leaped in her womb, and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She exclaimed with a loud voice, “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the child in your womb!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And who am I that the mother of my Lord should come and visit me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the instant the sound of your greeting reached my ears, the baby in my womb leaped for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And blessed is she who believed that what was spoken to her by the Lord would be fulfilled.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Mary said,
“My soul exalts the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and my spirit has begun to rejoice in God my Savior,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because he has looked upon the humble state of his servant.
For from now on all generations will call me blessed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he who is mighty has done great things for me, and holy is his name;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from generation to generation he is merciful to those who fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has demonstrated power with his arm; he has scattered those whose pride wells up from the sheer arrogance of their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has brought down the mighty from their thrones, and has lifted up those of lowly position;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he has filled the hungry with good things, and has sent the rich away empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has helped his servant Israel, remembering his mercy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as he promised to our ancestors, to Abraham and to his descendants forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Mary stayed with Elizabeth about three months and then returned to her home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the time came for Elizabeth to have her baby, and she gave birth to a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord had shown great mercy to her, and they rejoiced with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day they came to circumcise the child, and they wanted to name him Zechariah after his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his mother replied, “No! He must be named John.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to her, “But none of your relatives bears this name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they made signs to the baby’s father, inquiring what he wanted to name his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked for a writing tablet and wrote, “His name is John.” And they were all amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately Zechariah’s mouth was opened and his tongue released, and he spoke, blessing God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All their neighbors were filled with fear, and throughout the entire hill country of Judea all these things were talked about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who heard these things kept them in their hearts, saying, “What then will this child be?” For the Lord’s hand was indeed with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his father Zechariah was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Blessed be the Lord God of Israel,
because he has come to help and has redeemed his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as he spoke through the mouth of his holy prophets from long ago,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that we should be saved from our enemies,
and from the hand of all who hate us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has done this to show mercy to our ancestors,
and to remember his holy covenant—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the oath that he swore to our ancestor Abraham.
This oath grants
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that we, being rescued from the hand of our enemies,
may serve him without fear,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in holiness and righteousness before him for as long as we live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And you, child, will be called the prophet of the Most High.
For you will go before the Lord to prepare his ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to give his people knowledge of salvation through the forgiveness of their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of our God’s tender mercy
the dawn will break upon us from on high
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to give light to those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death,
to guide our feet into the way of peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the child kept growing and becoming strong in spirit, and he was in the wilderness until the day he was revealed to Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in those days a decree went out from Caesar Augustus to register all the empire for taxes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the first registration, taken when Quirinius was governor of Syria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone went to his own town to be registered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph also went up from the town of Nazareth in Galilee to Judea, to the city of David called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and family line of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went to be registered with Mary, who was promised in marriage to him, and who was expecting a child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were there, the time came for her to deliver her child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she gave birth to her firstborn son and wrapped him in strips of cloth and laid him in a manger, because there was no place for them in the inn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were shepherds nearby living out in the field, keeping guard over their flock at night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An angel of the Lord appeared to them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were absolutely terrified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the angel said to them, “Do not be afraid! Listen carefully, for I proclaim to you good news that brings great joy to all the people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today your Savior is born in the city of David. He is Christ the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This will be a sign for you: You will find a baby wrapped in strips of cloth and lying in a manger.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly a vast, heavenly army appeared with the angel, praising God and saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Glory to God in the highest,
and on earth peace among people with whom he is pleased!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the angels left them and went back to heaven, the shepherds said to one another, “Let us go over to Bethlehem and see this thing that has taken place, that the Lord has made known to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they hurried off and located Mary and Joseph, and found the baby lying in a manger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw him, they related what they had been told about this child,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all who heard it were astonished at what the shepherds said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Mary treasured up all these words, pondering in her heart what they might mean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all they had heard and seen; everything was just as they had been told.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the end of eight days, when he was circumcised, he was named Jesus, the name given by the angel before he was conceived in the womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the time came for their purification according to the law of Moses, Joseph and Mary brought Jesus up to Jerusalem to present him to the Lord
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (just as it is written in the law of the Lord, “Every firstborn male will be set apart to the Lord”),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to offer a sacrifice according to what is specified in the law of the Lord, a pair of doves or two young pigeons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a man in Jerusalem named Simeon who was righteous and devout, looking for the restoration of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he would not die before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Simeon, directed by the Spirit, came into the temple courts, and when the parents brought in the child Jesus to do for him what was customary according to the law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simeon took him in his arms and blessed God, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now, according to your word, Sovereign Lord, permit your servant to depart in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For my eyes have seen your salvation
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you have prepared in the presence of all peoples:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: So the child’s father and mother were amazed at what was said about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simeon blessed them and said to his mother Mary, “Listen carefully: This child is destined to be the cause of the falling and rising of many in Israel and to be a sign that will be rejected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, as a result of him the thoughts of many hearts will be revealed—and a sword will pierce your own soul as well!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was also a prophetess, Anna the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher. She was very old, having been married to her husband for seven years until his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She had lived as a widow since then for eighty-four years. She never left the temple, worshiping with fasting and prayer night and day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that moment, she came up to them and began to give thanks to God and to speak about the child to all who were waiting for the redemption of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Joseph and Mary had performed everything according to the law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee, to their own town of Nazareth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the child grew and became strong, filled with wisdom, and the favor of God was upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus’ parents went to Jerusalem every year for the Feast of the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was twelve years old, they went up according to custom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the feast was over, as they were returning home, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem. His parents did not know it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but (because they assumed that he was in their group of travelers) they went a day’s journey. Then they began to look for him among their relatives and acquaintances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they did not find him, they returned to Jerusalem to look for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After three days they found him in the temple courts, sitting among the teachers, listening to them and asking them questions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all who heard Jesus were astonished at his understanding and his answers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his parents saw him, they were overwhelmed. His mother said to him, “Child, why have you treated us like this? Look, your father and I have been looking for you anxiously.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he replied, “Why were you looking for me? Didn’t you know that I must be in my Father’s house?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Yet his parents did not understand the remark he made to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went down with them and came to Nazareth, and was obedient to them. But his mother kept all these things in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus increased in wisdom and in stature, and in favor with God and with people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, when Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea, and Herod was tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip was tetrarch of the region of Iturea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias was tetrarch of Abilene,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: during the high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John the son of Zechariah in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went into all the region around the Jordan River, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As it is written in the book of the words of the prophet Isaiah,
“The voice of one shouting in the wilderness:
‘Prepare the way for the Lord,
make his paths straight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every valley will be filled,
and every mountain and hill will be brought low,
and the crooked will be made straight,
and the rough ways will be made smooth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all humanity will see the salvation of God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So John said to the crowds that came out to be baptized by him, “You offspring of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore produce fruit that proves your repentance, and don’t begin to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’ For I tell you that God can raise up children for Abraham from these stones!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even now the ax is laid at the root of the trees, and every tree that does not produce good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the crowds were asking him, “What then should we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered them, “The person who has two tunics must share with the person who has none, and the person who has food must do likewise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tax collectors also came to be baptized, and they said to him, “Teacher, what should we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “Collect no more than you are required to.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some soldiers also asked him, “And as for us—what should we do?” He told them, “Take money from no one by violence or by false accusation, and be content with your pay.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the people were filled with anticipation and they all wondered whether perhaps John could be the Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered them all, “I baptize you with water, but one more powerful than I am is coming—I am not worthy to untie the strap of his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His winnowing fork is in his hand to clean out his threshing floor and to gather the wheat into his storehouse, but the chaff he will burn up with inextinguishable fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in this way, with many other exhortations, John proclaimed good news to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when John rebuked Herod the tetrarch because of Herodias, his brother’s wife, and because of all the evil deeds that he had done,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod added this to them all: He locked up John in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when all the people were baptized, Jesus also was baptized. And while he was praying, the heavens opened,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Holy Spirit descended on him in bodily form like a dove. And a voice came from heaven, “You are my one dear Son; in you I take great delight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus, when he began his ministry, was about thirty years old. He was the son (as was supposed) of Joseph, the son of Heli,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semein, the son of Josech, the son of Joda,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmadam, the son of Er,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Joshua, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonam, the son of Eliakim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Melea, the son of Menna, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Sala, the son of Nahshon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Amminadab, the son of Admin, the son of Arni, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalalel, the son of Kenan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Enosh, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan River and was led by the Spirit in the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: where for forty days he endured temptations from the devil. He ate nothing during those days, and when they were completed, he was famished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The devil said to him, “If you are the Son of God, command this stone to become bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “It is written, ‘Man does not live by bread alone.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil led him up to a high place and showed him in a flash all the kingdoms of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “To you I will grant this whole realm—and the glory that goes along with it, for it has been relinquished to me, and I can give it to anyone I wish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, if you will worship me, all this will be yours.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “It is written, ‘You are to worship the Lord your God and serve only him.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil brought him to Jerusalem, had him stand on the highest point of the temple, and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down from here,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it is written, ‘He will command his angels concerning you, to protect you,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ‘with their hands they will lift you up, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “It is said, ‘You are not to put the Lord your God to the test.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So when the devil had completed every temptation, he departed from him until a more opportune time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, in the power of the Spirit, returned to Galilee, and news about him spread throughout the surrounding countryside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He began to teach in their synagogues and was praised by all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up, and went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day, as was his custom. He stood up to read,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the scroll of the prophet Isaiah was given to him. He unrolled the scroll and found the place where it was written,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Spirit of the Lord is upon me,
because he has anointed me to proclaim good news to the poor.
He has sent me to proclaim release to the captives
and the regaining of sight to the blind,
to set free those who are oppressed,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: to proclaim the year of the Lord’s favor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he rolled up the scroll, gave it back to the attendant, and sat down. The eyes of everyone in the synagogue were fixed on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he began to tell them, “Today this scripture has been fulfilled even as you heard it being read.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: All were speaking well of him, and were amazed at the gracious words coming out of his mouth. They said, “Isn’t this Joseph’s son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “No doubt you will quote to me the proverb, ‘Physician, heal yourself!’ and say, ‘What we have heard that you did in Capernaum, do here in your hometown too.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he added, “I tell you the truth, no prophet is acceptable in his hometown.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But in truth I tell you, there were many widows in Israel in Elijah’s days, when the sky was shut up three and a half years, and there was a great famine over all the land.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Yet Elijah was sent to none of them, but only to a woman who was a widow at Zarephath in Sidon.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And there were many lepers in Israel in the time of the prophet Elisha, yet none of them was cleansed except Naaman the Syrian.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When they heard this, all the people in the synagogue were filled with rage.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: They got up, forced him out of the town, and brought him to the brow of the hill on which their town was built, so that they could throw him down the cliff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he passed through the crowd and went on his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went down to Capernaum, a town in Galilee, and on the Sabbath he began to teach the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were amazed at his teaching, because he spoke with authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the synagogue there was a man who had the spirit of an unclean demon, and he cried out with a loud voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Ha! Leave us alone, Jesus the Nazarene! Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But Jesus rebuked him: “Silence! Come out of him!” Then, after the demon threw the man down in their midst, he came out of him without hurting him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: They were all amazed and began to say to one another, “What’s happening here? For with authority and power he commands the unclean spirits, and they come out!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the news about him spread into all areas of the region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus left the synagogue, he entered Simon’s house. Now Simon’s mother-in-law was suffering from a high fever, and they asked Jesus to help her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he stood over her, commanded the fever, and it left her. Immediately she got up and began to serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the sun was setting, all those who had any relatives sick with various diseases brought them to Jesus. He placed his hands on every one of them and healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Demons also came out of many, crying out, “You are the Son of God!” But he rebuked them, and would not allow them to speak, because they knew that he was the Christ.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The next morning Jesus departed and went to a deserted place. Yet the crowds were seeking him, and they came to him and tried to keep him from leaving them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to them, “I must proclaim the good news of the kingdom of God to the other towns too, for that is what I was sent to do.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So he continued to preach in the synagogues of Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus was standing by the Lake of Gennesaret, and the crowd was pressing around him to hear the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saw two boats by the lake, but the fishermen had gotten out of them and were washing their nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He got into one of the boats, which was Simon’s, and asked him to put out a little way from the shore. Then Jesus sat down and taught the crowds from the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had finished speaking, he said to Simon, “Put out into the deep water and lower your nets for a catch.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon answered, “Master, we worked hard all night and caught nothing! But at your word I will lower the nets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had done this, they caught so many fish that their nets started to tear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they motioned to their partners in the other boat to come and help them. And they came and filled both boats, so that they were about to sink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, “Go away from me, Lord, for I am a sinful man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Peter and all who were with him were astonished at the catch of fish that they had taken,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and so were James and John, Zebedee’s sons, who were Simon’s business partners. Then Jesus said to Simon, “Do not be afraid; from now on you will be catching people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they had brought their boats to shore, they left everything and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jesus was in one of the towns, a man came to him who was covered with leprosy. When he saw Jesus, he bowed down with his face to the ground and begged him, “Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he stretched out his hand and touched him, saying, “I am willing. Be clean!” And immediately the leprosy left him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he ordered the man to tell no one, but commanded him, “Go and show yourself to a priest, and bring the offering for your cleansing, as Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the news about him spread even more, and large crowds were gathering together to hear him and to be healed of their illnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet Jesus himself frequently withdrew to the wilderness and prayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on one of those days, while he was teaching, there were Pharisees and teachers of the law sitting nearby (who had come from every village of Galilee and Judea and from Jerusalem), and the power of the Lord was with him to heal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then some men showed up, carrying a paralyzed man on a stretcher. They were trying to bring him in and place him before Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But since they found no way to carry him in because of the crowd, they went up on the roof and let him down on the stretcher through the roof tiles right in front of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw their faith he said, “Friend, your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the experts in the law and the Pharisees began to think to themselves, “Who is this man who is uttering blasphemies? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus perceived their hostile thoughts, he said to them, “Why are you raising objections within yourselves?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Stand up and walk’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—he said to the paralyzed man—“I tell you, stand up, take your stretcher and go home.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately he stood up before them, picked up the stretcher he had been lying on, and went home, glorifying God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then astonishment seized them all, and they glorified God. They were filled with awe, saying, “We have seen incredible things today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Jesus went out and saw a tax collector named Levi sitting at the tax booth. “Follow me,” he said to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he got up and followed him, leaving everything behind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Levi gave a great banquet in his house for Jesus, and there was a large crowd of tax collectors and others sitting at the table with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees and their experts in the law complained to his disciples, saying, “Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Those who are well don’t need a physician, but those who are sick do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to him, “John’s disciples frequently fast and pray, and so do the disciples of the Pharisees, but yours continue to eat and drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to them, “You cannot make the wedding guests fast while the bridegroom is with them, can you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those days are coming, and when the bridegroom is taken from them, at that time they will fast.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also told them a parable: “No one tears a patch from a new garment and sews it on an old garment. If he does, he will have torn the new, and the piece from the new will not match the old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no one pours new wine into old wineskins. If he does, the new wine will burst the skins and will be spilled, and the skins will be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead new wine must be poured into new wineskins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one after drinking old wine wants the new, for he says, ‘The old is good enough.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was going through the grain fields on a Sabbath, and his disciples picked some heads of wheat, rubbed them in their hands, and ate them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of the Pharisees said, “Why are you doing what is against the law on the Sabbath?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Haven’t you read what David did when he and his companions were hungry—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how he entered the house of God, took and ate the sacred bread, which is not lawful for any to eat but the priests alone, and gave it to his companions?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “The Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On another Sabbath, Jesus entered the synagogue and was teaching. Now a man was there whose right hand was withered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The experts in the law and the Pharisees watched Jesus closely to see if he would heal on the Sabbath, so that they could find a reason to accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he knew their thoughts, and said to the man who had the withered hand, “Get up and stand here.” So he rose and stood there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “I ask you, is it lawful to do good on the Sabbath or to do evil, to save a life or to destroy it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After looking around at them all, he said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” The man did so, and his hand was restored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were filled with mindless rage and began debating with one another what they would do to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was during this time that Jesus went out to the mountain to pray, and he spent all night in prayer to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When morning came, he called his disciples and chose twelve of them, whom he also named apostles:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon (whom he named Peter), and his brother Andrew; and James, John, Philip, Bartholomew,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Matthew, Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, Simon who was called the Zealot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas the son of James, and Judas Iscariot, who became a traitor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came down with them and stood on a level place. And a large number of his disciples had gathered along with a vast multitude from all over Judea, from Jerusalem, and from the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon. They came to hear him and to be healed of their diseases,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and those who suffered from unclean spirits were cured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole crowd was trying to touch him, because power was coming out from him and healing them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he looked up at his disciples and said:
“Blessed are you who are poor, for the kingdom of God belongs to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Blessed are you who hunger now, for you will be satisfied.
“Blessed are you who weep now, for you will laugh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Blessed are you when people hate you, and when they exclude you and insult you and reject you as evil on account of the Son of Man!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rejoice in that day, and jump for joy, because your reward is great in heaven. For their ancestors did the same things to the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But woe to you who are rich, for you have received your comfort already.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to you who are well satisfied with food now, for you will be hungry.
“Woe to you who laugh now, for you will mourn and weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you when all people speak well of you, for their ancestors did the same things to the false prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But I say to you who are listening: Love your enemies, do good to those who hate you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: bless those who curse you, pray for those who mistreat you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the person who strikes you on the cheek, offer the other as well, and from the person who takes away your coat, do not withhold your tunic either.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give to everyone who asks you, and do not ask for your possessions back from the person who takes them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Treat others in the same way that you would want them to treat you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? Even sinners do the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you lend to those from whom you hope to be repaid, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, so that they may be repaid in full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing back. Then your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High, because he is kind to ungrateful and evil people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be merciful, just as your Father is merciful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not judge, and you will not be judged; do not condemn, and you will not be condemned; forgive, and you will be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give, and it will be given to you: A good measure, pressed down, shaken together, running over, will be poured into your lap. For the measure you use will be the measure you receive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also told them a parable: “Someone who is blind cannot lead another who is blind, can he? Won’t they both fall into a pit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A disciple is not greater than his teacher, but everyone when fully trained will be like his teacher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you see the speck in your brother’s eye, but fail to see the beam of wood in your own?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How can you say to your brother, ‘Brother, let me remove the speck from your eye,’ while you yourself don’t see the beam in your own? You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck from your brother’s eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For no good tree bears bad fruit, nor again does a bad tree bear good fruit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for each tree is known by its own fruit. For figs are not gathered from thorns, nor are grapes picked from brambles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The good person out of the good treasury of his heart produces good, and the evil person out of his evil treasury produces evil, for his mouth speaks from what fills his heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do you call me ‘Lord, Lord,’ and don’t do what I tell you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Everyone who comes to me and listens to my words and puts them into practice—I will show you what he is like:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is like a man building a house, who dug down deep, and laid the foundation on bedrock. When a flood came, the river burst against that house but could not shake it, because it had been well built.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the person who hears and does not put my words into practice is like a man who built a house on the ground without a foundation. When the river burst against that house, it collapsed immediately, and was utterly destroyed!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus had finished teaching all this to the people, he entered Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A centurion there had a slave who was highly regarded, but who was sick and at the point of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the centurion heard about Jesus, he sent some Jewish elders to him, asking him to come and heal his slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to Jesus, they urged him earnestly, “He is worthy to have you do this for him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he loves our nation, and even built our synagogue.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus went with them. When he was not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to say to him, “Lord, do not trouble yourself, for I am not worthy to have you come under my roof!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why I did not presume to come to you. Instead, say the word, and my servant must be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I too am a man set under authority, with soldiers under me. I say to this one, ‘Go!’ and he goes, and to another, ‘Come!’ and he comes, and to my slave, ‘Do this!’ and he does it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard this, he was amazed at him. He turned and said to the crowd that followed him, “I tell you, not even in Israel have I found such faith!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when those who had been sent returned to the house, they found the slave well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soon afterward Jesus went to a town called Nain, and his disciples and a large crowd went with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he approached the town gate, a man who had died was being carried out, the only son of his mother (who was a widow), and a large crowd from the town was with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord saw her, he had compassion for her and said to her, “Do not weep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came up and touched the bier, and those who carried it stood still. He said, “Young man, I say to you, get up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the dead man sat up and began to speak, and Jesus gave him back to his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear seized them all, and they began to glorify God, saying, “A great prophet has appeared among us!” and “God has come to help his people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This report about Jesus circulated throughout Judea and all the surrounding country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John’s disciples informed him about all these things. So John called two of his disciples
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sent them to Jesus to ask, “Are you the one who is to come, or should we look for another?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the men came to Jesus, they said, “John the Baptist has sent us to you to ask, ‘Are you the one who is to come, or should we look for another?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that very time Jesus cured many people of diseases, sicknesses, and evil spirits, and granted sight to many who were blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he answered them, “Go tell John what you have seen and heard: The blind see, the lame walk, lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, the poor have good news proclaimed to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is anyone who takes no offense at me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When John’s messengers had gone, Jesus began to speak to the crowds about John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What did you go out to see? A man dressed in soft clothing? Look, those who wear soft clothing and live in luxury are in the royal palaces!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and more than a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the one about whom it is written, ‘Look, I am sending my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way before you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, among those born of women no one is greater than John. Yet the one who is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he is.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now all the people who heard this, even the tax collectors, acknowledged God’s justice, because they had been baptized with John’s baptism.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the Pharisees and the experts in religious law rejected God’s purpose for themselves, because they had not been baptized by John.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “To what then should I compare the people of this generation, and what are they like?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: For John the Baptist has come eating no bread and drinking no wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Look at him, a glutton and a drunk, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But wisdom is vindicated by all her children.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now one of the Pharisees asked Jesus to have dinner with him, so he went into the Pharisee’s house and took his place at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when a woman of that town, who was a sinner, learned that Jesus was dining at the Pharisee’s house, she brought an alabaster jar of perfumed oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As she stood behind him at his feet, weeping, she began to wet his feet with her tears. She wiped them with her hair, kissed them, and anointed them with the perfumed oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the Pharisee who had invited him saw this, he said to himself, “If this man were a prophet, he would know who and what kind of woman this is who is touching him, that she is a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus answered him, “Simon, I have something to say to you.” He replied, “Say it, Teacher.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A certain creditor had two debtors; one owed him 500 silver coins, and the other fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they could not pay, he canceled the debts of both. Now which of them will love him more?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon answered, “I suppose the one who had the bigger debt canceled.” Jesus said to him, “You have judged rightly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, turning toward the woman, he said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? I entered your house. You gave me no water for my feet, but she has wet my feet with her tears and wiped them with her hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You gave me no kiss of greeting, but from the time I entered she has not stopped kissing my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You did not anoint my head with oil, but she has anointed my feet with perfumed oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I tell you, her sins, which were many, are forgiven, thus she loved much; but the one who is forgiven little loves little.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to her, “Your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those who were at the table with him began to say among themselves, “Who is this, who even forgives sins?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you; go in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some time afterward he went on through towns and villages, preaching and proclaiming the good news of the kingdom of God. The twelve were with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and also some women who had been healed of evil spirits and disabilities: Mary (called Magdalene), from whom seven demons had gone out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Joanna the wife of Cuza (Herod’s household manager), Susanna, and many others who provided for them out of their own resources.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While a large crowd was gathering and people were coming to Jesus from one town after another, he spoke to them in a parable:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A sower went out to sow his seed. And as he sowed, some fell along the path and was trampled on, and the wild birds devoured it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other seed fell on rock, and when it came up, it withered because it had no moisture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other seed fell among the thorns, and they grew up with it and choked it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But other seed fell on good soil and grew, and it produced a hundred times as much grain.” As he said this, he called out, “The one who has ears to hear had better listen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his disciples asked him what this parable meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “You have been given the opportunity to know the secrets of the kingdom of God, but for others they are in parables, so that although they see they may not see, and although they hear they may not understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now the parable means this: The seed is the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those along the path are the ones who have heard; then the devil comes and takes away the word from their hearts, so that they may not believe and be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those on the rock are the ones who receive the word with joy when they hear it, but they have no root. They believe for a while, but in a time of testing fall away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the seed that fell among thorns, these are the ones who hear, but as they go on their way they are choked by the worries and riches and pleasures of life, and their fruit does not mature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for the seed that landed on good soil, these are the ones who, after hearing the word, cling to it with an honest and good heart, and bear fruit with steadfast endurance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one lights a lamp and then covers it with a jar or puts it under a bed, but puts it on a lampstand so that those who come in can see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nothing is hidden that will not be revealed, and nothing concealed that will not be made known and brought to light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So listen carefully, for whoever has will be given more, but whoever does not have, even what he thinks he has will be taken from him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus’ mother and his brothers came to him, but they could not get near him because of the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he was told, “Your mother and your brothers are standing outside, wanting to see you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he replied to them, “My mother and my brothers are those who hear the word of God and do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day Jesus got into a boat with his disciples and said to them, “Let’s go across to the other side of the lake.” So they set out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as they sailed he fell asleep. Now a violent windstorm came down on the lake, and the boat started filling up with water, and they were in danger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came and woke him, saying, “Master, Master, we are about to die!” So he got up and rebuked the wind and the raging waves; they died down, and it was calm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “Where is your faith?” But they were afraid and amazed, saying to one another, “Who then is this? He commands even the winds and the water, and they obey him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they sailed over to the region of the Gerasenes, which is opposite Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus stepped ashore, a certain man from the town met him who was possessed by demons. For a long time this man had worn no clothes and had not lived in a house, but among the tombs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw Jesus, he cried out, fell down before him, and shouted with a loud voice, “Leave me alone, Jesus, Son of the Most High God! I beg you, do not torment me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Jesus had started commanding the evil spirit to come out of the man. (For it had seized him many times, so he would be bound with chains and shackles and kept under guard. But he would break the restraints and be driven by the demon into deserted places.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus then asked him, “What is your name?” He said, “Legion,” because many demons had entered him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began to beg him not to order them to depart into the abyss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a large herd of pigs was feeding there on the hillside, and the demonic spirits begged Jesus to let them go into them. He gave them permission.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the demons came out of the man and went into the pigs, and the herd of pigs rushed down the steep slope into the lake and drowned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the herdsmen saw what had happened, they ran off and spread the news in the town and countryside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people went out to see what had happened, and they came to Jesus. They found the man from whom the demons had gone out, sitting at Jesus’ feet, clothed and in his right mind, and they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who had seen it told them how the man who had been demon-possessed had been healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people of the Gerasenes and the surrounding region asked Jesus to leave them alone, for they were seized with great fear. So he got into the boat and left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man from whom the demons had gone out begged to go with him, but Jesus sent him away, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Return to your home, and declare what God has done for you.” So he went away, proclaiming throughout the whole town what Jesus had done for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus returned, the crowd welcomed him, because they were all waiting for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a man named Jairus, who was a leader of the synagogue, came up. Falling at Jesus’ feet, he pleaded with him to come to his house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because he had an only daughter, about twelve years old, and she was dying.
As Jesus was on his way, the crowds pressed around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a woman was there who had been suffering from a hemorrhage for twelve years but could not be healed by anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She came up behind Jesus and touched the edge of his cloak, and at once the bleeding stopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus asked, “Who was it who touched me?” When they all denied it, Peter said, “Master, the crowds are surrounding you and pressing against you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Someone touched me, for I know that power has gone out from me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the woman saw that she could not escape notice, she came trembling and fell down before him. In the presence of all the people, she explained why she had touched him and how she had been immediately healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, someone from the synagogue leader’s house came and said, “Your daughter is dead; do not trouble the teacher any longer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus heard this, he told him, “Do not be afraid; just believe, and she will be healed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he came to the house, Jesus did not let anyone go in with him except Peter, John, and James, and the child’s father and mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they were all wailing and mourning for her, but he said, “Stop your weeping; she is not dead but asleep!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began making fun of him, because they knew that she was dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus gently took her by the hand and said, “Child, get up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her spirit returned, and she got up immediately. Then he told them to give her something to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her parents were astonished, but he ordered them to tell no one what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus called the twelve together, he gave them power and authority over all demons and to cure diseases,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he sent them out to proclaim the kingdom of God and to heal the sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Take nothing for your journey—no staff, no bag, no bread, no money, and do not take an extra tunic.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever house you enter, stay there until you leave the area.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherever they do not receive you, as you leave that town, shake the dust off your feet as a testimony against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they departed and went throughout the villages, proclaiming the good news and healing people everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Herod the tetrarch heard about everything that was happening, and he was thoroughly perplexed, because some people were saying that John had been raised from the dead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while others were saying that Elijah had appeared, and still others that one of the prophets of long ago had risen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod said, “I had John beheaded, but who is this about whom I hear such things?” So Herod wanted to learn about Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the apostles returned, they told Jesus everything they had done. Then he took them with him and they withdrew privately to a town called Bethsaida.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the crowds found out, they followed him. He welcomed them, spoke to them about the kingdom of God, and cured those who needed healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the day began to draw to a close, so the twelve came and said to Jesus, “Send the crowd away, so they can go into the surrounding villages and countryside and find lodging and food, because we are in an isolated place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “You give them something to eat.” They replied, “We have no more than five loaves and two fish—unless we go and buy food for all these people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now about 5,000 men were there.) Then he said to his disciples, “Have them sit down in groups of about fifty each.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they did as Jesus directed, and the people all sat down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven he gave thanks and broke them. He gave them to the disciples to set before the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all ate and were satisfied, and what was left over was picked up—twelve baskets of broken pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once when Jesus was praying by himself, and his disciples were nearby, he asked them, “Who do the crowds say that I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered, “John the Baptist; others say Elijah; and still others that one of the prophets of long ago has risen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter answered, “The Christ of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he forcefully commanded them not to tell this to anyone,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “The Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders, chief priests, and experts in the law, and be killed, and on the third day be raised.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them all, “If anyone wants to become my follower, he must deny himself, take up his cross daily, and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life because of me will save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what does it benefit a person if he gains the whole world but loses or forfeits himself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever is ashamed of me and my words, the Son of Man will be ashamed of that person when he comes in his glory and in the glory of the Father and of the holy angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you most certainly, there are some standing here who will not experience death before they see the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now about eight days after these sayings, Jesus took with him Peter, John, and James, and went up the mountain to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was praying, the appearance of his face was transformed, and his clothes became very bright, a brilliant white.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then two men, Moses and Elijah, began talking with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They appeared in glorious splendor and spoke about his departure that he was about to carry out at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Peter and those with him were quite sleepy, but as they became fully awake, they saw his glory and the two men standing with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then as the men were starting to leave, Peter said to Jesus, “Master, it is good for us to be here. Let us make three shelters, one for you and one for Moses and one for Elijah”—not knowing what he was saying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was saying this, a cloud came and overshadowed them, and they were afraid as they entered the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a voice came from the cloud, saying, “This is my Son, my Chosen One. Listen to him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the voice had spoken, Jesus was found alone. So they kept silent and told no one at that time anything of what they had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the next day, when they had come down from the mountain, a large crowd met him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a man from the crowd cried out, “Teacher, I beg you to look at my son—he is my only child!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A spirit seizes him, and he suddenly screams; it throws him into convulsions and causes him to foam at the mouth. It hardly ever leaves him alone, torturing him severely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I begged your disciples to cast it out, but they could not do so.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “You unbelieving and perverse generation! How much longer must I be with you and endure you? Bring your son here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the boy was approaching, the demon threw him to the ground and shook him with convulsions. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, healed the boy, and gave him back to his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they were all astonished at the mighty power of God.
But while the entire crowd was amazed at everything Jesus was doing, he said to his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take these words to heart, for the Son of Man is going to be betrayed into the hands of men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not understand this statement; its meaning had been concealed from them, so that they could not grasp it. Yet they were afraid to ask him about this statement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now an argument started among the disciples as to which of them might be the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus discerned their innermost thoughts, he took a child, had him stand by his side,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “Whoever welcomes this child in my name welcomes me, and whoever welcomes me welcomes the one who sent me, for the one who is least among you all is the one who is great.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered, “Master, we saw someone casting out demons in your name, and we tried to stop him because he is not a disciple along with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Do not stop him, for whoever is not against you is for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the days drew near for him to be taken up, Jesus set out resolutely to go to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent messengers on ahead of him. As they went along, they entered a Samaritan village to make things ready in advance for him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the villagers refused to welcome him, because he was determined to go to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when his disciples James and John saw this, they said, “Lord, do you want us to call fire to come down from heaven and consume them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus turned and rebuked them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they went on to another village.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were walking along the road, someone said to him, “I will follow you wherever you go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Foxes have dens and the birds in the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to another, “Follow me.” But he replied, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Let the dead bury their own dead, but as for you, go and proclaim the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet another said, “I will follow you, Lord, but first let me say goodbye to my family.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “No one who puts his hand to the plow and looks back is fit for the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this the Lord appointed seventy-two others and sent them on ahead of him two by two into every town and place where he himself was about to go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “The harvest is plentiful, but the workers are few. Therefore ask the Lord of the harvest to send out workers into his harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go! I am sending you out like lambs surrounded by wolves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not carry a money bag, a traveler’s bag, or sandals, and greet no one on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever you enter a house, first say, ‘May peace be on this house!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a peace-loving person is there, your peace will remain on him, but if not, it will return to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stay in that same house, eating and drinking what they give you, for the worker deserves his pay. Do not move around from house to house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever you enter a town and the people welcome you, eat what is set before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heal the sick in that town and say to them, ‘The kingdom of God has come upon you!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whenever you enter a town and the people do not welcome you, go into its streets and say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Even the dust of your town that clings to our feet we wipe off against you. Nevertheless know this: The kingdom of God has come.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, it will be more bearable on that day for Sodom than for that town!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the miracles done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it will be more bearable for Tyre and Sidon in the judgment than for you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, Capernaum, will you be exalted to heaven? No, you will be thrown down to Hades!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The one who listens to you listens to me, and the one who rejects you rejects me, and the one who rejects me rejects the one who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the seventy-two returned with joy, saying, “Lord, even the demons submit to us in your name!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to them, “I saw Satan fall like lightning from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, I have given you authority to tread on snakes and scorpions and on the full force of the enemy, and nothing will hurt you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, do not rejoice that the spirits submit to you, but rejoice that your names stand written in heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that same occasion Jesus rejoiced in the Holy Spirit and said, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from the wise and intelligent, and revealed them to little children. Yes, Father, for this was your gracious will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things have been given to me by my Father. No one knows who the Son is except the Father, or who the Father is except the Son and anyone to whom the Son decides to reveal him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus turned to his disciples and said privately, “Blessed are the eyes that see what you see!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you that many prophets and kings longed to see what you see but did not see it, and to hear what you hear but did not hear it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now an expert in religious law stood up to test Jesus, saying, “Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “What is written in the law? How do you understand it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The expert answered, “Love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your strength, and with all your mind, and love your neighbor as yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “You have answered correctly; do this, and you will live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the expert, wanting to justify himself, said to Jesus, “And who is my neighbor?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “A man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell into the hands of robbers, who stripped him, beat him up, and went off, leaving him half dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now by chance a priest was going down that road, but when he saw the injured man he passed by on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So too a Levite, when he came up to the place and saw him, passed by on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a Samaritan who was traveling came to where the injured man was, and when he saw him, he felt compassion for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went up to him and bandaged his wounds, pouring olive oil and wine on them. Then he put him on his own animal, brought him to an inn, and took care of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day he took out two silver coins and gave them to the innkeeper, saying, ‘Take care of him, and whatever else you spend, I will repay you when I come back this way.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which of these three do you think became a neighbor to the man who fell into the hands of the robbers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The expert in religious law said, “The one who showed mercy to him.” So Jesus said to him, “Go and do the same.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as they went on their way, Jesus entered a certain village where a woman named Martha welcomed him as a guest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She had a sister named Mary, who sat at the Lord’s feet and listened to what he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Martha was distracted with all the preparations she had to make, so she came up to him and said, “Lord, don’t you care that my sister has left me to do all the work alone? Tell her to help me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord answered her, “Martha, Martha, you are worried and troubled about many things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but one thing is needed. Mary has chosen the best part; it will not be taken away from her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus was praying in a certain place. When he stopped, one of his disciples said to him, “Lord, teach us to pray, just as John taught his disciples.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Give us each day our daily bread,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and forgive us our sins,
for we also forgive everyone who sins against us.
And do not lead us into temptation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “Suppose one of you has a friend, and you go to him at midnight and say to him, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves of bread,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because a friend of mine has stopped here while on a journey, and I have nothing to set before him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he will reply from inside, ‘Do not bother me. The door is already shut, and my children and I are in bed. I cannot get up and give you anything.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, even though the man inside will not get up and give him anything because he is his friend, yet because of the first man’s sheer persistence he will get up and give him whatever he needs.
verses.speaker: Narrator
