verses.text: “So I tell you: Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and the door will be opened for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For everyone who asks receives, and the one who seeks finds, and to the one who knocks, the door will be opened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What father among you, if your son asks for a fish, will give him a snake instead of a fish?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if he asks for an egg, will give him a scorpion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you then, although you are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will the heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he was casting out a demon that was mute. When the demon had gone out, the man who had been mute began to speak, and the crowds were amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of them said, “By the power of Beelzebul, the ruler of demons, he casts out demons!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others, to test him, began asking for a sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, realizing their thoughts, said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is destroyed, and a divided household falls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if Satan too is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? I ask you this because you claim that I cast out demons by Beelzebul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if I cast out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your sons cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I cast out demons by the finger of God, then the kingdom of God has already overtaken you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a strong man, fully armed, guards his own palace, his possessions are safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when a stronger man attacks and conquers him, he takes away the first man’s armor on which the man relied and divides up his plunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever is not with me is against me, and whoever does not gather with me scatters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When an unclean spirit goes out of a person, it passes through waterless places looking for rest but not finding any. Then it says, ‘I will return to the home I left.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it returns, it finds the house swept clean and put in order.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it goes and brings seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they go in and live there, so the last state of that person is worse than the first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he said these things, a woman in the crowd spoke out to him, “Blessed is the womb that bore you and the breasts at which you nursed!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he replied, “Blessed rather are those who hear the word of God and obey it!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the crowds were increasing, Jesus began to say, “This generation is a wicked generation; it looks for a sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For just as Jonah became a sign to the people of Nineveh, so the Son of Man will be a sign to this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The queen of the South will rise up at the judgment with the people of this generation and condemn them, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon—and now, something greater than Solomon is here!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because they repented when Jonah preached to them—and now, something greater than Jonah is here!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one after lighting a lamp puts it in a hidden place or under a basket, but on a lampstand, so that those who come in can see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your eye is the lamp of your body. When your eye is healthy, your whole body is full of light, but when it is diseased, your body is full of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore see to it that the light in you is not darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then your whole body is full of light, with no part in the dark, it will be as full of light as when the light of a lamp shines on you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he spoke, a Pharisee invited Jesus to have a meal with him, so he went in and took his place at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisee was astonished when he saw that Jesus did not first wash his hands before the meal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to him, “Now you Pharisees clean the outside of the cup and the plate, but inside you are full of greed and wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You fools! Didn’t the one who made the outside make the inside as well?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But give from your heart to those in need, and then everything will be clean for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But woe to you Pharisees! You give a tenth of your mint, rue, and every herb, yet you neglect justice and love for God! But you should have done these things without neglecting the others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you Pharisees! You love the best seats in the synagogues and elaborate greetings in the marketplaces!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you! You are like unmarked graves, and people walk over them without realizing it!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the experts in religious law answered him, “Teacher, when you say these things you insult us too.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus replied, “Woe to you experts in religious law as well! You load people down with burdens difficult to bear, yet you yourselves refuse to touch the burdens with even one of your fingers!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you! You build the tombs of the prophets whom your ancestors killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you testify that you approve of the deeds of your ancestors, because they killed the prophets and you build their tombs!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason also the wisdom of God said, ‘I will send them prophets and apostles, some of whom they will kill and persecute,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that this generation may be held accountable for the blood of all the prophets that has been shed since the beginning of the world,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah, who was killed between the altar and the sanctuary. Yes, I tell you, it will be charged against this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you experts in religious law! You have taken away the key to knowledge! You did not go in yourselves, and you hindered those who were going in.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he went out from there, the experts in the law and the Pharisees began to oppose him bitterly, and to ask him hostile questions about many things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: plotting against him, to catch him in something he might say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, when many thousands of the crowd had gathered so that they were trampling on one another, Jesus began to speak first to his disciples, “Be on your guard against the yeast of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nothing is hidden that will not be revealed, and nothing is secret that will not be made known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then whatever you have said in the dark will be heard in the light, and what you have whispered in private rooms will be proclaimed from the housetops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you, my friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body, and after that have nothing more they can do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will warn you whom you should fear: Fear the one who, after the killing, has authority to throw you into hell. Yes, I tell you, fear him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aren’t five sparrows sold for two pennies? Yet not one of them is forgotten before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, even the hairs on your head are all numbered. Do not be afraid; you are more valuable than many sparrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you, whoever acknowledges me before men, the Son of Man will also acknowledge before God’s angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who denies me before men will be denied before God’s angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but the person who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they bring you before the synagogues, the rulers, and the authorities, do not worry about how you should make your defense or what you should say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Holy Spirit will teach you at that moment what you must say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then someone from the crowd said to him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Man, who made me a judge or arbitrator between you two?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “Watch out and guard yourself from all types of greed, because one’s life does not consist in the abundance of his possessions.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He then told them a parable: “The land of a certain rich man produced an abundant crop,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so he thought to himself, ‘What should I do, for I have nowhere to store my crops?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, ‘I will do this: I will tear down my barns and build bigger ones, and there I will store all my grain and my goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will say to myself, “You have plenty of goods stored up for many years; relax, eat, drink, celebrate!”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God said to him, ‘You fool! This very night your life will be demanded back from you, but who will get what you have prepared for yourself?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it is with the one who stores up riches for himself, but is not rich toward God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to his disciples, “Therefore I tell you, do not worry about your life, what you will eat, or about your body, what you will wear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there is more to life than food, and more to the body than clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider the ravens: They do not sow or reap, they have no storeroom or barn, yet God feeds them. How much more valuable are you than the birds!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And which of you by worrying can add an hour to his life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if you cannot do such a very little thing as this, why do you worry about the rest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider how the flowers grow; they do not work or spin. Yet I tell you, not even Solomon in all his glory was clothed like one of these!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if this is how God clothes the wild grass, which is here today and tomorrow is tossed into the fire to heat the oven, how much more will he clothe you, you people of little faith!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So do not be overly concerned about what you will eat and what you will drink, and do not worry about such things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the nations of the world pursue these things, and your Father knows that you need them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, pursue his kingdom, and these things will be given to you as well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not be afraid, little flock, for your Father is well pleased to give you the kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sell your possessions and give to the poor. Provide yourselves purses that do not wear out—a treasure in heaven that never decreases, where no thief approaches and no moth destroys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Get dressed for service and keep your lamps burning;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: be like people waiting for their master to come back from the wedding celebration, so that when he comes and knocks they can immediately open the door for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed are those slaves whom their master finds alert when he returns! I tell you the truth, he will dress himself to serve, have them take their place at the table, and will come and wait on them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if he comes in the second or third watch of the night and finds them alert, blessed are those slaves!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But understand this: If the owner of the house had known at what hour the thief was coming, he would not have let his house be broken into.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at an hour when you do not expect him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said, “Lord, are you telling this parable for us or for everyone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord replied, “Who then is the faithful and wise manager, whom the master puts in charge of his household servants, to give them their allowance of food at the proper time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is that slave whom his master finds at work when he returns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth, the master will put him in charge of all his possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if that slave should say to himself, ‘My master is delayed in returning,’ and he begins to beat the other slaves, both men and women, and to eat, drink, and get drunk,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the master of that slave will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he does not foresee, and will cut him in two, and assign him a place with the unfaithful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That servant who knew his master’s will but did not get ready or do what his master asked will receive a severe beating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who did not know his master’s will and did things worthy of punishment will receive a light beating. From everyone who has been given much, much will be required, and from the one who has been entrusted with much, even more will be asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have come to bring fire on the earth—and how I wish it were already kindled!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have a baptism to undergo, and how distressed I am until it is finished!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you think I have come to bring peace on earth? No, I tell you, but rather division!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For from now on there will be five in one household divided, three against two and two against three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be divided, father against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus also said to the crowds, “When you see a cloud rising in the west, you say at once, ‘A rainstorm is coming,’ and it does.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you see the south wind blowing, you say, ‘There will be scorching heat,’ and there is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the sky, but how can you not know how to interpret the present time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And why don’t you judge for yourselves what is right?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As you are going with your accuser before the magistrate, make an effort to settle with him on the way, so that he will not drag you before the judge, and the judge hand you over to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, you will never get out of there until you have paid the very last cent!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were some present on that occasion who told him about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “Do you think these Galileans were worse sinners than all the other Galileans, because they suffered these things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, I tell you! But unless you repent, you will all perish as well!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or those eighteen who were killed when the tower in Siloam fell on them, do you think they were worse offenders than all the others who live in Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, I tell you! But unless you repent you will all perish as well!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told this parable: “A man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard, and he came looking for fruit on it and found none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to the worker who tended the vineyard, ‘For three years now, I have come looking for fruit on this fig tree, and each time I inspect it I find none. Cut it down! Why should it continue to deplete the soil?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the worker answered him, ‘Sir, leave it alone this year too, until I dig around it and put fertilizer on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then if it bears fruit next year, very well, but if not, you can cut it down.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a woman was there who had been disabled by a spirit for eighteen years. She was bent over and could not straighten herself up completely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw her, he called her to him and said, “Woman, you are freed from your infirmity.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he placed his hands on her, and immediately she straightened up and praised God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the president of the synagogue, indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, said to the crowd, “There are six days on which work should be done! So come and be healed on those days, and not on the Sabbath day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord answered him, “You hypocrites! Does not each of you on the Sabbath untie his ox or his donkey from its stall, and lead it to water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shouldn’t this woman, a daughter of Abraham whom Satan bound for eighteen long years, be released from this imprisonment on the Sabbath day?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he said this all his adversaries were humiliated, but the entire crowd was rejoicing at all the wonderful things he was doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Jesus asked, “What is the kingdom of God like? To what should I compare it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like a mustard seed that a man took and sowed in his garden. It grew and became a tree, and the wild birds nested in its branches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he said, “To what should I compare the kingdom of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like yeast that a woman took and mixed with three measures of flour until all the dough had risen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus traveled throughout towns and villages, teaching and making his way toward Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone asked him, “Lord, will only a few be saved?” So he said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Exert every effort to enter through the narrow door, because many, I tell you, will try to enter and will not be able to.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once the head of the house gets up and shuts the door, then you will stand outside and start to knock on the door and beg him, ‘Lord, let us in!’ But he will answer you, ‘I don’t know where you come from.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will begin to say, ‘We ate and drank in your presence, and you taught in our streets.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he will reply, ‘I don’t know where you come from! Go away from me, all you evildoers!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth when you see Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and all the prophets in the kingdom of God but you yourselves thrown out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then people will come from east and west, and from north and south, and take their places at the banquet table in the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But indeed, some are last who will be first, and some are first who will be last.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, some Pharisees came up and said to Jesus, “Get away from here, because Herod wants to kill you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “Go and tell that fox, ‘Look, I am casting out demons and performing healings today and tomorrow, and on the third day I will complete my work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless I must go on my way today and tomorrow and the next day, because it is impossible that a prophet should be killed outside Jerusalem.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those who are sent to you! How often I have longed to gather your children together as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you would have none of it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, your house is forsaken! And I tell you, you will not see me until you say, ‘Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now one Sabbath when Jesus went to dine at the house of a leader of the Pharisees, they were watching him closely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There right in front of him was a man whose body was swollen with fluid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus asked the experts in religious law and the Pharisees, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they remained silent. So Jesus took hold of the man, healed him, and sent him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “Which of you, if you have a son or an ox that has fallen into a well on a Sabbath day, will not immediately pull him out?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they could not reply to this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when Jesus noticed how the guests chose the places of honor, he told them a parable. He said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you are invited by someone to a wedding feast, do not take the place of honor, because a person more distinguished than you may have been invited by your host.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the host who invited both of you will come and say to you, ‘Give this man your place.’ Then, ashamed, you will begin to move to the least important place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you are invited, go and take the least important place, so that when your host approaches he will say to you, ‘Friend, move up here to a better place.’ Then you will be honored in the presence of all who share the meal with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but the one who humbles himself will be exalted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said also to the man who had invited him, “When you host a dinner or a banquet, don’t invite your friends or your brothers or your relatives or rich neighbors so you can be invited by them in return and get repaid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you host an elaborate meal, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, and the blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will be blessed, because they cannot repay you, for you will be repaid at the resurrection of the righteous.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When one of those at the meal with Jesus heard this, he said to him, “Blessed is everyone who will feast in the kingdom of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “A man once gave a great banquet and invited many guests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the time for the banquet he sent his slave to tell those who had been invited, ‘Come, because everything is now ready.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one after another they all began to make excuses. The first said to him, ‘I have bought a field, and I must go out and see it. Please excuse me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another said, ‘I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I am going out to examine them. Please excuse me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another said, ‘I just got married, and I cannot come.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the slave came back and reported this to his master. Then the master of the household was furious and said to his slave, ‘Go out quickly to the streets and alleys of the city, and bring in the poor, the crippled, the blind, and the lame.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the slave said, ‘Sir, what you instructed has been done, and there is still room.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the master said to his slave, ‘Go out to the highways and country roads and urge people to come in, so that my house will be filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you, not one of those individuals who were invited will taste my banquet!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now large crowds were accompanying Jesus, and turning to them he said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone comes to me and does not hate his own father and mother, and wife and children, and brothers and sisters, and even his own life, he cannot be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever does not carry his own cross and follow me cannot be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For which of you, wanting to build a tower, doesn’t sit down first and compute the cost to see if he has enough money to complete it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, when he has laid a foundation and is not able to finish the tower, all who see it will begin to make fun of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will say, ‘This man began to build and was not able to finish!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or what king, going out to confront another king in battle, will not sit down first and determine whether he is able with 10,000 to oppose the one coming against him with 20,000?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he cannot succeed, he will send a representative while the other is still a long way off and ask for terms of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way therefore not one of you can be my disciple if he does not renounce all his own possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Salt is good, but if salt loses its flavor, how can its flavor be restored?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is of no value for the soil or for the manure pile; it is to be thrown out. The one who has ears to hear had better listen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all the tax collectors and sinners were coming to hear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees and the experts in the law were complaining, “This man welcomes sinners and eats with them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus told them this parable:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Which one of you, if he has a hundred sheep and loses one of them, would not leave the ninety-nine in the open pasture and go look for the one that is lost until he finds it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when he has found it, he places it on his shoulders, rejoicing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Returning home, he calls together his friends and neighbors, telling them, ‘Rejoice with me, because I have found my sheep that was lost.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, in the same way there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous people who have no need to repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Or what woman, if she has ten silver coins and loses one of them, does not light a lamp, sweep the house, and search thoroughly until she finds it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when she has found it, she calls together her friends and neighbors, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found the coin that I had lost.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, I tell you, there is joy in the presence of God’s angels over one sinner who repents.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “A man had two sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me the share of the estate that will belong to me.’ So he divided his assets between them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After a few days, the younger son gathered together all he had and left on a journey to a distant country, and there he squandered his wealth with a wild lifestyle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then after he had spent everything, a severe famine took place in that country, and he began to be in need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went and worked for one of the citizens of that country, who sent him to his fields to feed pigs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was longing to eat the carob pods the pigs were eating, but no one gave him anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he came to his senses he said, ‘How many of my father’s hired workers have food enough to spare, but here I am dying from hunger!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will get up and go to my father and say to him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am no longer worthy to be called your son; treat me like one of your hired workers.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he got up and went to his father. But while he was still a long way from home his father saw him, and his heart went out to him; he ran and hugged his son and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you; I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the father said to his slaves, ‘Hurry! Bring the best robe, and put it on him! Put a ring on his finger and sandals on his feet!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring the fattened calf and kill it! Let us eat and celebrate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because this son of mine was dead, and is alive again—he was lost and is found!’ So they began to celebrate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now his older son was in the field. As he came and approached the house, he heard music and dancing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he called one of the slaves and asked what was happening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The slave replied, ‘Your brother has returned, and your father has killed the fattened calf because he got his son back safe and sound.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the older son became angry and refused to go in. His father came out and appealed to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he answered his father, ‘Look! These many years I have worked like a slave for you, and I never disobeyed your commands. Yet you never gave me even a goat so that I could celebrate with my friends!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when this son of yours came back, who has devoured your assets with prostitutes, you killed the fattened calf for him!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the father said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and everything that belongs to me is yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was appropriate to celebrate and be glad, for your brother was dead, and is alive; he was lost and is found.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus also said to the disciples, “There was a rich man who was informed of accusations that his manager was wasting his assets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he called the manager in and said to him, ‘What is this I hear about you? Turn in the account of your administration, because you can no longer be my manager.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the manager said to himself, ‘What should I do, since my master is taking my position away from me? I’m not strong enough to dig, and I’m too ashamed to beg.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know what to do so that when I am put out of management, people will welcome me into their homes.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he contacted his master’s debtors one by one. He asked the first, ‘How much do you owe my master?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man replied, ‘100 measures of olive oil.’ The manager said to him, ‘Take your bill, sit down quickly, and write fifty.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to another, ‘And how much do you owe?’ The second man replied, ‘100 measures of wheat.’ The manager said to him, ‘Take your bill, and write 80.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The master commended the dishonest manager because he acted shrewdly. For the people of this world are more shrewd in dealing with their contemporaries than the people of light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I tell you, make friends for yourselves by how you use worldly wealth, so that when it runs out you will be welcomed into the eternal homes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The one who is faithful in a very little is also faithful in much, and the one who is dishonest in a very little is also dishonest in much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then you haven’t been trustworthy in handling worldly wealth, who will entrust you with the true riches?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you haven’t been trustworthy with someone else’s property, who will give you your own ?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No servant can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and money.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees (who loved money) heard all this and ridiculed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to them, “You are the ones who justify yourselves in men’s eyes, but God knows your hearts. For what is highly prized among men is utterly detestable in God’s sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The law and the prophets were in force until John; since then, the good news of the kingdom of God has been proclaimed, and everyone is urged to enter it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for one tiny stroke of a letter in the law to become void.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Everyone who divorces his wife and marries someone else commits adultery, and the one who marries a woman divorced from her husband commits adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There was a rich man who dressed in purple and fine linen and who feasted sumptuously every day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But at his gate lay a poor man named Lazarus whose body was covered with sores,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who longed to eat what fell from the rich man’s table. In addition, the dogs came and licked his sores.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now the poor man died and was carried by the angels to Abraham’s side. The rich man also died and was buried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in Hades, as he was in torment, he looked up and saw Abraham far off with Lazarus at his side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he called out, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus to dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue, because I am in anguish in this fire.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Abraham said, ‘Child, remember that in your lifetime you received your good things and Lazarus likewise bad things, but now he is comforted here and you are in anguish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Besides all this, a great chasm has been fixed between us, so that those who want to cross over from here to you cannot do so, and no one can cross from there to us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the rich man said, ‘Then I beg you, father—send Lazarus to my father’s house
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for I have five brothers) to warn them so that they don’t come into this place of torment.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Abraham said, ‘They have Moses and the prophets; they must respond to them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the rich man said, ‘No, father Abraham, but if someone from the dead goes to them, they will repent.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied to him, ‘If they do not respond to Moses and the prophets, they will not be convinced even if someone rises from the dead.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to his disciples, “Stumbling blocks are sure to come, but woe to the one through whom they come!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It would be better for him to have a millstone tied around his neck and be thrown into the sea than for him to cause one of these little ones to sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch yourselves! If your brother sins, rebuke him. If he repents, forgive him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if he sins against you seven times in a day, and seven times returns to you saying, ‘I repent,’ you must forgive him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord replied, “If you had faith the size of a mustard seed, you could say to this black mulberry tree, ‘Be pulled out by the roots and planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Would any one of you say to your slave who comes in from the field after plowing or shepherding sheep, ‘Come at once and sit down for a meal’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Won’t the master instead say to him, ‘Get my dinner ready, and make yourself ready to serve me while I eat and drink. Then you may eat and drink’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He won’t thank the slave because he did what he was told, will he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you too, when you have done everything you were commanded to do, should say, ‘We are slaves undeserving of special praise; we have only done what was our duty.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the way to Jerusalem, Jesus was passing along between Samaria and Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was entering a village, ten men with leprosy met him. They stood at a distance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: raised their voices and said, “Jesus, Master, have mercy on us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw them he said, “Go and show yourselves to the priests.” And as they went along, they were cleansed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of them, when he saw he was healed, turned back, praising God with a loud voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He fell with his face to the ground at Jesus’ feet and thanked him. (Now he was a Samaritan.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “Were not ten cleansed? Where are the other nine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was no one found to turn back and give praise to God except this foreigner?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to the man, “Get up and go your way. Your faith has made you well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at one point the Pharisees asked Jesus when the kingdom of God was coming, so he answered, “The kingdom of God is not coming with signs to be observed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor will they say, ‘Look, here it is!’ or ‘There!’ For indeed, the kingdom of God is in your midst.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to the disciples, “The days are coming when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then people will say to you, ‘Look, there he is!’ or ‘Look, here he is!’ Do not go out or chase after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For just like the lightning flashes and lights up the sky from one side to the other, so will the Son of Man be in his day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But first he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as it was in the days of Noah, so too it will be in the days of the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People were eating, they were drinking, they were marrying, they were being given in marriage—right up to the day Noah entered the ark. Then the flood came and destroyed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, just as it was in the days of Lot, people were eating, drinking, buying, selling, planting, building;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but on the day Lot went out from Sodom, fire and sulfur rained down from heaven and destroyed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be the same on the day the Son of Man is revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day, anyone who is on the roof, with his goods in the house, must not come down to take them away, and likewise the person in the field must not turn back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember Lot’s wife!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever tries to keep his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life will preserve it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, in that night there will be two people in one bed; one will be taken and the other left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be two women grinding grain together; one will be taken and the other left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples said to him, “Where, Lord?” He replied to them, “Where the dead body is, there the vultures will gather.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told them a parable to show them they should always pray and not lose heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “In a certain city there was a judge who neither feared God nor respected people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was also a widow in that city who kept coming to him and saying, ‘Give me justice against my adversary.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a while he refused, but later on he said to himself, ‘Though I neither fear God nor have regard for people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet because this widow keeps on bothering me, I will give her justice, or in the end she will wear me out by her unending pleas.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, “Listen to what the unrighteous judge says!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Won’t God give justice to his chosen ones, who cry out to him day and night? Will he delay long to help them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, he will give them justice speedily. Nevertheless, when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on earth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus also told this parable to some who were confident that they were righteous and looked down on everyone else.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Two men went up to the temple to pray, one a Pharisee and the other a tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisee stood and prayed about himself like this: ‘God, I thank you that I am not like other people: extortionists, unrighteous people, adulterers—or even like this tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I fast twice a week; I give a tenth of everything I get.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tax collector, however, stood far off and would not even look up to heaven, but beat his breast and said, ‘God, be merciful to me, sinner that I am!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you that this man went down to his home justified rather than the Pharisee. For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but he who humbles himself will be exalted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now people were even bringing their babies to him for him to touch. But when the disciples saw it, they began to scold those who brought them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus called for the children, saying, “Let the little children come to me and do not try to stop them, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God like a child will never enter it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a certain leader asked him, “Good teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good except God alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the commandments: ‘Do not commit adultery, do not murder, do not steal, do not give false testimony, honor your father and mother.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man replied, “I have wholeheartedly obeyed all these laws since my youth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard this, he said to him, “One thing you still lack. Sell all that you have and give the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the man heard this he became very sad, for he was extremely wealthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus noticed this, he said, “How hard it is for the rich to enter the kingdom of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who heard this said, “Then who can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied, “What is impossible for mere humans is possible for God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said, “Look, we have left everything we own to follow you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “I tell you the truth, there is no one who has left home or wife or brothers or parents or children for the sake of God’s kingdom
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who will not receive many times more in this age—and in the age to come, eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus took the twelve aside and said to them, “Look, we are going up to Jerusalem, and everything that is written about the Son of Man by the prophets will be accomplished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he will be handed over to the Gentiles; he will be mocked, mistreated, and spat on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will flog him severely and kill him. Yet on the third day he will rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the twelve understood none of these things. This saying was hidden from them, and they did not grasp what Jesus meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus approached Jericho, a blind man was sitting by the road begging.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard a crowd going by, he asked what was going on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told him, “Jesus the Nazarene is passing by.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he called out, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who were in front scolded him to get him to be quiet, but he shouted even more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus stopped and ordered the beggar to be brought to him. When the man came near, Jesus asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do you want me to do for you?” He replied, “Lord, let me see again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Receive your sight; your faith has healed you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately he regained his sight and followed Jesus, praising God. When all the people saw it, they too gave praise to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus entered Jericho and was passing through it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a man named Zacchaeus was there; he was a chief tax collector and was rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was trying to get a look at Jesus, but being a short man he could not see over the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he ran on ahead and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see him, because Jesus was going to pass that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus came to that place, he looked up and said to him, “Zacchaeus, come down quickly, because I must stay at your house today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he came down quickly and welcomed Jesus joyfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the people saw it, they all complained, “He has gone in to be the guest of a man who is a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Zacchaeus stopped and said to the Lord, “Look, Lord, half of my possessions I now give to the poor, and if I have cheated anyone of anything, I am paying back four times as much!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to him, “Today salvation has come to this household, because he too is a son of Abraham!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save the lost.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the people were listening to these things, Jesus proceeded to tell a parable, because he was near to Jerusalem, and because they thought that the kingdom of God was going to appear immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he said, “A nobleman went to a distant country to receive for himself a kingdom and then return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he summoned ten of his slaves, gave them ten minas, and said to them, ‘Do business with these until I come back.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his citizens hated him and sent a delegation after him, saying, ‘We do not want this man to be king over us!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he returned after receiving the kingdom, he summoned these slaves to whom he had given the money. He wanted to know how much they had earned by trading.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the first one came before him and said, ‘Sir, your mina has made ten minas more.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king said to him, ‘Well done, good slave! Because you have been faithful in a very small matter, you will have authority over ten cities.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the second one came and said, ‘Sir, your mina has made five minas.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king said to him, ‘And you are to be over five cities.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then another slave came and said, ‘Sir, here is your mina that I put away for safekeeping in a piece of cloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was afraid of you, because you are a severe man. You withdraw what you did not deposit and reap what you did not sow.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king said to him, ‘I will judge you by your own words, you wicked slave! So you knew, did you, that I was a severe man, withdrawing what I didn’t deposit and reaping what I didn’t sow?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why then didn’t you put my money in the bank, so that when I returned I could have collected it with interest?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to his attendants, ‘Take the mina from him, and give it to the one who has ten.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said to him, ‘Sir, he has ten minas already!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I tell you that everyone who has will be given more, but from the one who does not have, even what he has will be taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for these enemies of mine who did not want me to be their king, bring them here and slaughter them in front of me!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus had said this, he continued on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he approached Bethphage and Bethany, at the place called the Mount of Olives, he sent two of the disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: telling them, “Go to the village ahead of you. When you enter it, you will find a colt tied there that has never been ridden. Untie it and bring it here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ just say, ‘The Lord needs it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So those who were sent ahead found it exactly as he had told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were untying the colt, its owners asked them, “Why are you untying that colt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They replied, “The Lord needs it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they brought it to Jesus, threw their cloaks on the colt, and had Jesus get on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he rode along, they spread their cloaks on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he approached the road leading down from the Mount of Olives, the whole crowd of his disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works they had seen:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Blessed is the king who comes in the name of the Lord! Peace in heaven and glory in the highest!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of the Pharisees in the crowd said to him, “Teacher, rebuke your disciples.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “I tell you, if they keep silent, the very stones will cry out!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus approached and saw the city, he wept over it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “If you had only known on this day, even you, the things that make for peace! But now they are hidden from your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the days will come upon you when your enemies will build an embankment against you and surround you and close in on you from every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will demolish you—you and your children within your walls—and they will not leave within you one stone on top of another, because you did not recognize the time of your visitation from God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus entered the temple courts and began to drive out those who were selling things there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying to them, “It is written, ‘My house will be a house of prayer,’ but you have turned it into a den of robbers!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was teaching daily in the temple courts. The chief priests and the experts in the law and the prominent leaders among the people were seeking to assassinate him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they could not find a way to do it, for all the people hung on his words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now one day, as Jesus was teaching the people in the temple courts and proclaiming the gospel, the chief priests and the experts in the law with the elders came up
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to him, “Tell us: By what authority are you doing these things? Or who is it who gave you this authority?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “I will also ask you a question, and you tell me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John’s baptism—was it from heaven or from people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they discussed it with one another, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Why did you not believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘From people,’ all the people will stone us, because they are convinced that John was a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they replied that they did not know where it came from.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by whose authority I do these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he began to tell the people this parable: “A man planted a vineyard, leased it to tenant farmers, and went on a journey for a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When harvest time came, he sent a slave to the tenants so that they would give him his portion of the crop. However, the tenants beat his slave and sent him away empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he sent another slave. They beat this one too, treated him outrageously, and sent him away empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he sent still a third. They even wounded this one, and threw him out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the owner of the vineyard said, ‘What should I do? I will send my one dear son; perhaps they will respect him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the tenants saw him, they said to one another, ‘This is the heir; let’s kill him so the inheritance will be ours!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him. What then will the owner of the vineyard do to them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will come and destroy those tenants and give the vineyard to others.” When the people heard this, they said, “May this never happen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus looked straight at them and said, “Then what is the meaning of that which is written: ‘The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, and the one on whom it falls will be crushed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the experts in the law and the chief priests wanted to arrest him that very hour, because they realized he had told this parable against them. But they were afraid of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they watched him carefully and sent spies who pretended to be sincere. They wanted to take advantage of what he might say so that they could deliver him up to the authority and jurisdiction of the governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus they asked him, “Teacher, we know that you speak and teach correctly, and show no partiality, but teach the way of God in accordance with the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it right for us to pay the tribute tax to Caesar or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus perceived their deceit and said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Show me a denarius. Whose image and inscription are on it?” They said, “Caesar’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to them, “Then give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus they were unable in the presence of the people to trap him with his own words. And stunned by his answer, they fell silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now some Sadducees (who contend that there is no resurrection) came to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother dies leaving a wife but no children, that man must marry the widow and father children for his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were seven brothers. The first one married a woman and died without children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then the third married her, and in this same way all seven died, leaving no children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally the woman died too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the resurrection, therefore, whose wife will the woman be? For all seven had married her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to them, “The people of this age marry and are given in marriage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those who are regarded as worthy to share in that age and in the resurrection from the dead neither marry nor are given in marriage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, they can no longer die, because they are equal to angels and are sons of God, since they are sons of the resurrection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even Moses revealed that the dead are raised in the passage about the bush, where he calls the Lord the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he is not God of the dead, but of the living, for all live before him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of the experts in the law answered, “Teacher, you have spoken well!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they did not dare any longer to ask him anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “How is it that they say that the Christ is David’s son?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For David himself says in the book of Psalms,
‘The Lord said to my lord,
“Sit at my right hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If David then calls him ‘Lord,’ how can he be his son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As all the people were listening, Jesus said to his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Beware of the experts in the law. They like walking around in long robes, and they love elaborate greetings in the marketplaces and the best seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at banquets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They devour widows’ property, and as a show make long prayers. They will receive a more severe punishment.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked up and saw the rich putting their gifts into the offering box.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also saw a poor widow put in two small copper coins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “I tell you the truth, this poor widow has put in more than all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they all offered their gifts out of their wealth. But she, out of her poverty, put in everything she had to live on.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while some were speaking about the temple, how it was adorned with beautiful stones and offerings, Jesus said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for these things that you are gazing at, the days will come when not one stone will be left on another. All will be torn down!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they asked him, “Teacher, when will these things happen? And what will be the sign that these things are about to take place?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Watch out that you are not misled. For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he,’ and, ‘The time is near.’ Do not follow them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you hear of wars and rebellions, do not be afraid. For these things must happen first, but the end will not come at once.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “Nation will rise up in arms against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be great earthquakes, and famines and plagues in various places, and there will be terrifying sights and great signs from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But before all this, they will seize you and persecute you, handing you over to the synagogues and prisons. You will be brought before kings and governors because of my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This will be a time for you to serve as witnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore be resolved not to rehearse ahead of time how to make your defense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will give you the words along with the wisdom that none of your adversaries will be able to withstand or contradict.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be betrayed even by parents, brothers, relatives, and friends, and they will have some of you put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be hated by everyone because of my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet not a hair of your head will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By your endurance you will gain your lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then know that its desolation has come near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then those who are in Judea must flee to the mountains. Those who are inside the city must depart. Those who are out in the country must not enter it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because these are days of vengeance, to fulfill all that is written.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing their babies in those days! For there will be great distress on the earth and wrath against this people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will fall by the edge of the sword and be led away as captives among all nations. Jerusalem will be trampled down by the Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And there will be signs in the sun and moon and stars, and on the earth nations will be in distress, anxious over the roaring of the sea and the surging waves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People will be fainting from fear and from the expectation of what is coming on the world, for the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will see the Son of Man arriving in a cloud with power and great glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when these things begin to happen, stand up and raise your heads, because your redemption is drawing near.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told them a parable: “Look at the fig tree and all the other trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they sprout leaves, you see for yourselves and know that summer is now near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also you, when you see these things happening, know that the kingdom of God is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth, this generation will not pass away until all these things take place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But be on your guard so that your hearts are not weighed down with dissipation and drunkenness and the worries of this life, and that day close down upon you suddenly like a trap.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it will overtake all who live on the face of the whole earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But stay alert at all times, praying that you may have strength to escape all these things that must happen, and to stand before the Son of Man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So every day Jesus was teaching in the temple courts, but at night he went and stayed on the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people came to him early in the morning to listen to him in the temple courts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Feast of Unleavened Bread, which is called the Passover, was approaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests and the experts in the law were trying to find some way to execute Jesus, for they were afraid of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Satan entered Judas, the one called Iscariot, who was one of the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went away and discussed with the chief priests and officers of the temple guard how he might betray Jesus, handing him over to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were delighted and arranged to give him money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Judas agreed and began looking for an opportunity to betray Jesus when no crowd was present.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the day for the feast of Unleavened Bread came, on which the Passover lamb had to be sacrificed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and prepare the Passover for us to eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Where do you want us to prepare it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Listen, when you have entered the city, a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him into the house that he enters,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and tell the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, “Where is the guest room where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he will show you a large furnished room upstairs. Make preparations there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went and found things just as he had told them, and they prepared the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the hour came, Jesus took his place at the table and the apostles joined him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “I have earnestly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you, I will not eat it again until it is fulfilled in the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took a cup, and after giving thanks he said, “Take this and divide it among yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you that from now on I will not drink of the fruit of the vine until the kingdom of God comes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took bread, and after giving thanks he broke it and gave it to them, saying, “This is my body which is given for you. Do this in remembrance of me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the same way he took the cup after they had eaten, saying, “This cup that is poured out for you is the new covenant in my blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But look, the hand of the one who betrays me is with me on the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man is to go just as it has been determined, but woe to that man by whom he is betrayed!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they began to question one another as to which of them it could possibly be who would do this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A dispute also started among them over which of them was to be regarded as the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to them, “The kings of the Gentiles lord it over them, and those in authority over them are called ‘benefactors.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not so with you; instead the one who is greatest among you must become like the youngest, and the leader like the one who serves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who is greater, the one who is seated at the table, or the one who serves? Is it not the one who is seated at the table? But I am among you as one who serves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are the ones who have remained with me in my trials.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus I grant to you a kingdom, just as my Father granted to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom, and you will sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Simon, Simon, pay attention! Satan has demanded to have you all, to sift you like wheat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I have prayed for you, Simon, that your faith may not fail. When you have turned back, strengthen your brothers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said to him, “Lord, I am ready to go with you both to prison and to death!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I tell you, Peter, the rooster will not crow today until you have denied three times that you know me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “When I sent you out with no money bag, or traveler’s bag, or sandals, you didn’t lack anything, did you?” They replied, “Nothing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “But now, the one who has a money bag must take it, and likewise a traveler’s bag too. And the one who has no sword must sell his cloak and buy one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you that this scripture must be fulfilled in me, ‘And he was counted with the transgressors.’ For what is written about me is being fulfilled.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said, “Look, Lord, here are two swords.” Then he told them, “It is enough.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went out and made his way, as he customarily did, to the Mount of Olives, and the disciples followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came to the place, he said to them, “Pray that you will not fall into temptation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went away from them about a stone’s throw, knelt down, and prayed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Father, if you are willing, take this cup away from me. Yet not my will but yours be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: [Then an angel from heaven appeared to him and strengthened him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in his anguish he prayed more earnestly, and his sweat was like drops of blood falling to the ground.]
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he got up from prayer, he came to the disciples and found them sleeping, exhausted from grief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to them, “Why are you sleeping? Get up and pray that you will not fall into temptation!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, suddenly a crowd appeared, and the man named Judas, one of the twelve, was leading them. He walked up to Jesus to kiss him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Judas, would you betray the Son of Man with a kiss?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When those who were around him saw what was about to happen, they said, “Lord, should we use our swords?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of them struck the high priest’s slave, cutting off his right ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Enough of this!” And he touched the man’s ear and healed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to the chief priests, the officers of the temple guard, and the elders who had come out to get him, “Have you come out with swords and clubs like you would against an outlaw?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Day after day when I was with you in the temple courts, you did not arrest me. But this is your hour, and that of the power of darkness!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they arrested Jesus, led him away, and brought him into the high priest’s house. But Peter was following at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had made a fire in the middle of the courtyard and sat down together, Peter sat down among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a slave girl, seeing him as he sat in the firelight, stared at him and said, “This man was with him too!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter denied it: “Woman, I don’t know him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a little later someone else saw him and said, “You are one of them too.” But Peter said, “Man, I am not!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after about an hour still another insisted, “Certainly this man was with him, because he too is a Galilean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said, “Man, I don’t know what you’re talking about!” At that moment, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord turned and looked straight at Peter, and Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how he had said to him, “Before a rooster crows today, you will deny me three times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went outside and wept bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the men who were holding Jesus under guard began to mock him and beat him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They blindfolded him and asked him repeatedly, “Prophesy! Who hit you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also said many other things against him, reviling him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When day came, the council of the elders of the people gathered together, both the chief priests and the experts in the law. Then they led Jesus away to their council
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “If you are the Christ, tell us.” But he said to them, “If I tell you, you will not believe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if I ask you, you will not answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But from now on the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they all said, “Are you the Son of God, then?” He answered them, “You say that I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said, “Why do we need further testimony? We have heard it ourselves from his own lips!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the whole group of them rose up and brought Jesus before Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to accuse him, saying, “We found this man subverting our nation, forbidding us to pay the tribute tax to Caesar and claiming that he himself is Christ, a king.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate asked Jesus, “Are you the king of the Jews?” He replied, “You say so.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate said to the chief priests and the crowds, “I find no basis for an accusation against this man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they persisted in saying, “He incites the people by teaching throughout all Judea. It started in Galilee and ended up here!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Pilate heard this, he asked whether the man was a Galilean.
verses.speaker: Narrator
