verses.text: When he learned that he was from Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him over to Herod, who also happened to be in Jerusalem at that time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Herod saw Jesus, he was very glad, for he had long desired to see him, because he had heard about him and was hoping to see him perform some miraculous sign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Herod questioned him at considerable length; Jesus gave him no answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests and the experts in the law were there, vehemently accusing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even Herod with his soldiers treated him with contempt and mocked him. Then, dressing him in elegant clothes, Herod sent him back to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That very day Herod and Pilate became friends with each other, for prior to this they had been enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate called together the chief priests, the leaders, and the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “You brought me this man as one who was misleading the people. When I examined him before you, I did not find this man guilty of anything you accused him of doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither did Herod, for he sent him back to us. Look, he has done nothing deserving death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will therefore have him flogged and release him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they all shouted out together, “Take this man away! Release Barabbas for us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (This was a man who had been thrown into prison for an insurrection started in the city, and for murder.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate addressed them once again because he wanted to release Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they kept on shouting, “Crucify, crucify him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A third time he said to them, “Why? What wrong has he done? I have found him guilty of no crime deserving death. I will therefore flog him and release him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were insistent, demanding with loud shouts that he be crucified. And their shouts prevailed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate decided that their demand should be granted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He released the man they asked for, who had been thrown in prison for insurrection and murder. But he handed Jesus over to their will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they led him away, they seized Simon of Cyrene, who was coming in from the country. They placed the cross on his back and made him carry it behind Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A great number of the people followed him, among them women who were mourning and wailing for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus turned to them and said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is certain: The days are coming when they will say, ‘Blessed are the barren, the wombs that never bore children, and the breasts that never nursed!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will begin to say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’ and to the hills, ‘Cover us!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if such things are done when the wood is green, what will happen when it is dry?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two other criminals were also led away to be executed with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they came to the place that is called “The Skull,” they crucified him there, along with the criminals, one on his right and one on his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: [But Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they don’t know what they are doing.”] Then they threw dice to divide his clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people also stood there watching, but the leaders ridiculed him, saying, “He saved others. Let him save himself if he is the Christ of God, his chosen one!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers also mocked him, coming up and offering him sour wine,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “If you are the king of the Jews, save yourself!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was also an inscription over him, “This is the king of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the criminals who was hanging there railed at him, saying, “Aren’t you the Christ? Save yourself and us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the other rebuked him, saying, “Don’t you fear God, since you are under the same sentence of condemnation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we rightly so, for we are getting what we deserve for what we did, but this man has done nothing wrong.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Jesus, remember me when you come in your kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “I tell you the truth, today you will be with me in paradise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was now about noon, and darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the sun’s light failed. The temple curtain was torn in two.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, calling out with a loud voice, said, “Father, into your hands I commit my spirit!” And after he said this he breathed his last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the centurion saw what had happened, he praised God and said, “Certainly this man was innocent!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the crowds that had assembled for this spectacle, when they saw what had taken place, returned home beating their breasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all those who knew Jesus stood at a distance, and the women who had followed him from Galilee saw these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a man named Joseph who was a member of the council, a good and righteous man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (He had not consented to their plan and action.) He was from the Judean town of Arimathea, and was looking forward to the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took it down, wrapped it in a linen cloth, and placed it in a tomb cut out of the rock, where no one had yet been buried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was the day of preparation and the Sabbath was beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The women who had accompanied Jesus from Galilee followed, and they saw the tomb and how his body was laid in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they returned and prepared aromatic spices and perfumes.
On the Sabbath they rested according to the commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the first day of the week, at early dawn, the women went to the tomb, taking the aromatic spices they had prepared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They found that the stone had been rolled away from the tomb,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when they went in, they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were perplexed about this, suddenly two men stood beside them in dazzling attire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The women were terribly frightened and bowed their faces to the ground, but the men said to them, “Why do you look for the living among the dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not here, but has been raised! Remember how he told you, while he was still in Galilee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the Son of Man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and on the third day rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the women remembered his words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they returned from the tomb they told all these things to the eleven and to all the rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and the other women with them who told these things to the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But these words seemed like pure nonsense to them, and they did not believe them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter got up and ran to the tomb. He bent down and saw only the strips of linen cloth; then he went home, wondering what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now that very day two of them were on their way to a village called Emmaus, about seven miles from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were talking to each other about all the things that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were talking and debating these things, Jesus himself approached and began to accompany them
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (but their eyes were kept from recognizing him).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “What are these matters you are discussing so intently as you walk along?” And they stood still, looking sad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of them, named Cleopas, answered him, “Are you the only visitor to Jerusalem who doesn’t know the things that have happened there in these days?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “What things?” “The things concerning Jesus the Nazarene,” they replied, “a man who, with his powerful deeds and words, proved to be a prophet before God and all the people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and how our chief priests and leaders handed him over to be condemned to death, and crucified him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we had hoped that he was the one who was going to redeem Israel. Not only this, but it is now the third day since these things happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, some women of our group amazed us. They were at the tomb early this morning,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they did not find his body, they came back and said they had seen a vision of angels, who said he was alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of those who were with us went to the tomb, and found it just as the women had said, but they did not see him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to them, “You foolish people—how slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wasn’t it necessary for the Christ to suffer these things and enter into his glory?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then beginning with Moses and all the prophets, he interpreted to them the things written about himself in all the scriptures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they approached the village where they were going. He acted as though he wanted to go farther,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they urged him, “Stay with us, because it is getting toward evening and the day is almost done.” So he went in to stay with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had taken his place at the table with them, he took the bread, blessed and broke it, and gave it to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this point their eyes were opened and they recognized him. Then he vanished out of their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to each other, “Didn’t our hearts burn within us while he was speaking with us on the road, while he was explaining the scriptures to us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they got up that very hour and returned to Jerusalem. They found the eleven and those with them gathered together
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “The Lord has really risen, and has appeared to Simon!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they told what had happened on the road, and how they recognized him when he broke the bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were saying these things, Jesus himself stood among them and said to them, “Peace be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were startled and terrified, thinking they saw a ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “Why are you frightened, and why do doubts arise in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look at my hands and my feet; it’s me! Touch me and see; a ghost does not have flesh and bones like you see I have.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they still could not believe it (because of their joy) and were amazed, he said to them, “Do you have anything here to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they gave him a piece of broiled fish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he took it and ate it in front of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “These are my words that I spoke to you while I was still with you, that everything written about me in the law of Moses and the prophets and the psalms must be fulfilled.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he opened their minds so they could understand the scriptures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “Thus it stands written that the Christ would suffer and would rise from the dead on the third day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and repentance for the forgiveness of sins would be proclaimed in his name to all nations, beginning from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are witnesses of these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And look, I am sending you what my Father promised. But stay in the city until you have been clothed with power from on high.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus led them out as far as Bethany, and lifting up his hands, he blessed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now during the blessing he departed and was taken up into heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they worshiped him and returned to Jerusalem with great joy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and were continually in the temple courts blessing God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
